INTRO.name: Foyer
INTRO.desc:
You are standing in front of a locked door in the foyer of a home.
The mat beneath your feet displays WELCOME, but you feel anything but.
To the NORTH is a plain wooden staircase missing some steps.
Exits to the EAST and WEST lead to other parts of the house.

START.name:
_______________THE______________________________
UU  UU NNN   NN _ RRRRR  EEEEEE     A     LL    
UU  UU NN N  NN| |RR  RR EE        AAA    LL    
UU  UU NN  N NN| |RRRR   EEEEE    AA AA   LL    
UU  UU NN   NNN| |RR  RR EE      AAAAAAA  LL    
UUUUUU NN    NN| |RR  RR EEEEEE AA     AA LLLLLL
               | |                              
EEEEEE  SSSSS__| |__   A  TTTTTTTT EEEEEE

____a text-adventure horror game of sorts by____
Christopher Butcher - MSCH-C220-13370 - IU, FA19
START.desc:
You hear the click of the door shutting behind you. You are standing in the entryway of a building... a home, even.
To the NORTH is a plain wooden staircase missing some steps.
Exits to the EAST and WEST lead to other parts of the house.

KITCH.name: Kitchen
KITCH.desc:
As you enter, your nose is filled with the smell of mildew.
The kitchen is dilapidated, with bits of the walls torn out and sprawled across the ground.
The sink sits on the ground, with its connective tissue still attached to the western wall.
To the NORTH you can see through an open doorway a dining room, to the EAST is the foyer where you began.

DINER.name: Dining room
DINER.desc:
Through the open doorway sits a long wooden table with six carved chairs.
In the center of the table is a small ornamental pumpkin.
On the long wall behind the table hangs a painting. While it is not of anything specific, it makes you feel uneasy.
In the corner of the room is a small plastic trashcan.
You look inside and see a grisly scene, as bones and meat line a large black trashbag encircled with flies. 
The smell is that of a feast, but what you see is carnage. Was this created by a human? Or some sort of beast with two mouths...
The only visible exit is to the SOUTH, back into the kitchen.

LIVRM.name: Living room
LIVRM.desc:
You enter the living room of this house. However, there does not appear to be any sort of living here. All of the furniture is covered in plastic, which in turn is covered in a thin layer of dust.
Large spaces where paintings used to hang line the walls, with an empty bookcase partially torn from the wall.
The windows out towards the south are covered by more plastic tarps.
To the NORTH is a short hallway and to the WEST is the foyer where this nightmare began.

HALL1.name: Hallway
HALL1.desc:
A short hallway sits mostly intact to the north of the living room.
Closed doors exist to the NORTH and WEST.

HALFB.name: Half bathroom
HALFB.desc:
As you open the bathroom door, your senses are assaulted by the smell of stagnant water and some sort of strong-smelling chemical.
The bathtub is lined with a blue tarp, but the walls and tarp are splattered in red.
The sink is mostly on the wall, but one corner sits covered in this red substance, chipped off and sitting on the linoleum.
A large circular saw sits on the seat of the toilet, still plugged in.
The only exit is back to the hallway to the SOUTH.

BASEM.name: Basement
BASEM.desc:
You stumble down a dim set of stairs.
As you reach the bottom step, your eyes begin to adjust to the darkness.
Scrawled onto the foundation of this home is some sort of arcane language that you cannot read.
As you stare into the concrete, you feel as though you are going mad.
What type of horrid rituals did they do down here? Better yet, are they finished?
You think you should go back EAST up the stairs as fast as you can...

BASE2.name: Basement????
BASE2.desc: The light flickers out and you hear a rattle in the walls. It is so dark in here, and you're no longer sure if you are alone...

LAND1.name: 2nd floor landing
LAND1.desc:
At the top of a steep flight of steps you see closed doors to the EAST and WEST. 
To the NORTH lies a hallway leading to more rooms.

GBED1.name: Guest bedroom
GBED1.desc:
The first thing you see upon entering this room is a king sized bed, perfectly kept, in the center of the room.
In the southwest corner of the room, a single professional-grade film camera sits on a tripod, pointed directly at you.
Other than these two things (and the door out to the EAST) there is nothing else in this room.

OFFICE.name: Cluttered office.
OFFICE.desc:
The large mahogany desk in this room is the only indication that this is an office,
 as the rest of the room is packed to the brim with boxes.
You pull a piece of paper out at random, and reveal a crude drawing of someone.
You believe you know this person, but are unsure where from... 
The large X drawn over their face makes their identification even harder.
You can leave to the WEST, back onto the landing.

HALL2.name: Upstairs hallway
HALL2.desc:
As you approach the door at the NORTH end of this hallway, your hands begin to shake.
Your feet feel as heavy as tombstones.

MBR1.name: The master bedroom
MBR1.desc:
This room does not appear to be lived-in. The bed, the wallpaper, the furniture...
 it all seems brand new./nYou feel a sense of calm for the first time today.

MBRX.name: The master bedroom
MBRX.desc: You begin to leave the bedroom, but then think better of it.

MBATH1.name: The master bathroom
MBATH1.desc:
This room practically sparkles in comparison to the rest of the home.
As you take stock of your surroundings, you catch a glimpse of yourself in the bathroom mirror.
How long has it been since you've seen your own reflection?
The face looking back at you feels more like a stranger...
You look towards the exit to the WEST.

MBR2.name: The master bedroom
MBR2.desc:
As you reemerge from the bathroom, you catch sight of a picture frame on the nightstand.
You recognize a familiar face in it.
As you reach for the picture, you hear an odd creak followed by a light thud from the hallway to the SOUTH...

MBR2A.name: The master bedroom
MBR2A.desc: You look from the door to the nightstand, but it appears to have fallen behind the bed. You wonder what the sound to the SOUTH was...

MBAT2A.name: The master bathroom
MBAT2A.desc: You attempt to walk back into the bathroom, but the sound from the SOUTH takes up your entire attention.

HALL2B.name: Upstairs hallway
HALL2B.desc:
As you exit the bedroom, you see that a small retractable ladder has been released from the ceiling, revealing an entry to the attic to the SOUTH.
Bits of dust wave in the hot, stale air coming from the opening.

MBR2B.name: Master bedroom
MBR2B.desc:
There's nothing for you in the master bedroom anymore. 
The only way to leave this nightmare is to the SOUTH, up the ladder to the attic.

ATTIC.name: Attic
ATTIC.desc:
You climb the rungs to a dusty attic. The air is stiff and hot.
There is a window overlooking a table, and on the table rests a set of keys. Your keys! You can finally leave!
As you pick them up, you hear a sound from outside. When you look through the small window, you see two being staring back at you.
Their eyes are focused on you. Their teeth shimmer. They are identical to one another in nearly every way, except that one is holding a large mallet.
You have to get out of this house...

ATTIC2.name: WHAT ARE YOU DOING?!
ATTIC2.desc: You think maybe they didn't see you (they did) and maybe you can just hide up here forever (you can't)...

LAND4.name: Top of the stairs
LAND4.desc:
You trip down the ladder, missing more than one rung in the process, praying that you can make it out alive.
From the top of the stairs, you hear the familiar sound of keys jingling outside of the door.
Your brain is screaming at you to leave this awful place, but the only exit you see is the door that is about to open to the SOUTH...

CANTHIDE.desc: YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM  YOU CANNOT HIDE FROM THEM

FOYER2.name: Foyer
FOYER2.desc: As you practically run down the flight of stairs, you see the doorknob in front of you turn  s l o w l y...

GETOUT.desc: G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !  G E T   O U T !

FOYER3.name: End of the line...
FOYER3.desc:
The door swings open, and for the first time you smell fresh air, freshly cut grass, flowers...
This almost distracts from the two hulking creatures blocking your path to the outside world.
A large hand clasps you on one shoulder as the two beings speak in one unified voice from two open maws:
 W E L C O M E  T O  Y O U R 
F   O   R   E   V   E   R      H   O   M   E

4YER.name: WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR??!!
4YER.desc:
The twin humanoids stare blankly at you, waiting... waiting for what?!
You have to get out. You have to head SOUTH. You have to end this, once and for all.

FINAL.name: Freedom...
FINAL.desc:
You shove straight through the twins, only to find many more people on the lawn.
Various humans carry cameras, boom mics, lights...
...
That's when you remember: your home is being renovated for HGTV's 'Property Brothers.' 

    T H E    E N D
